titleStmt.title: Lee Sing Wot v. Charles M. Bradshaw. Writ of Habeas Corpus

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Charles M. Bradshaw. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Before the Hon James E. Wyche Judge of the Dist Court of the United States in and for the Territory of Washington at Chambers in Port Townsend W.T.
Application for writ of Habeas Corpus by C.M. Bradshaw in behalf of Nicholas Adams and Thomas Gould of Clallam Co. W.T.

C.M. Bradshaw being duly sworn makes oath and says that he is informed and believes that Nicholas Adams and Thomas Gould are now illegally restrained of their liberty in the county of Clallam by a body of men styling them- selves a "Vigilance Committee" of whom E.H. McAlmond is styled Captain and SS Irwin D.F. Brownfield Clark Davis and some thirty others whose names deponent can hereafter give are members and principle actors.
That the cause or pretense of said as deponent is informed and believes is a mere suspicion that said Adams and Gould are bad and dangerous men
That they are restrained of their liberty without process of law by armed force and without any authority of law or proclamation.

Deponent is also informed and believes that said Vigilance Committee have threatened to expel by force said par- ties from the Territory and to execute them by mob law and that there is to believe that such thereto will be carried into execution before compliance with the Writ herein applied for can be enforced.

The herefore deponent prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may issue on behalf of said Adams and Gould to the end that the cause of their res- traint may be inquired into and they delivered therefrom in case said restraint be illegal.

And also that a warrant may issue to the proper office of the Court commanding him to take the persons thus held in custody and being themforth with before the court or Judge of the 3rd Judicial District W.T. holding terms at

Port Townsend and further that a com- mand be inserted in said warrant for the apprehension of the persons charged with causing and exercising said illegal restraint and that they be brought before said court or Judge to be dealt with according to law.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 14th day of Jun A.D. 1864 E.S. Dyer Clerk

Set the Writ issue as in complaint and as in the warrant an order for the arrest of E.N. McAlmond S.S. Irwin D.F. Brownfield and Clark Davis the parties charged with the illegal restraint of Nicholas Adams and Thomas Gould the writ returnable forthwith
Pet. for Writ of Habeas Corpus
E.N. McAlmond S.S. Irwin D.F. Brownfield and Clark Davis
Territory v. Nicholas Adams Thomas Gould
